intro: Mitracarpus bacigalupoae, commonly known as the Bacigalupo's mitracarpus, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and rocky habitats, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
